basics.name: Siddesh Shinde
basics.label: Distributed Systems Engineer
basics.summary: Distributed Systems Engineer passionate about solving real-world problems at scale, with expertise in performance optimizations and resilient architectures.

work.name: Cohesity
work.summary: Currently contributing to the Distributed File Systems team.
highlights: Proposed and shipped several performance optimizations for creates, links, renames, lookups and reverse lookups (25% to 20x gains). 5 US patents filed.
Optimized read/write in Key-Value and Logical data replication services.
Worked on Cloud Native Data-Platform (kubernetes orchestrators, fault tolerance abstraction, data plane unification, etc).
Root caused several critical data integrity issues. Lead a project to detect, fix and prevent corruption issues leading to 70% reduction within 2 quarters.

work.name: VMware
work.position: Member of Technical Staff, Intern - Cloud Platforms
work.summary: Developed a proof-of-concept for decentralized lifecycle management of Data Centers using GoLang.
highlights: Implemented a PoD service in AWS from the ground up, leveraging Kubernetes for container orchestration and scalability.

work.name: Qualcomm
work.summary: Enhanced the kernel bootloader for Snapdragon 700 series by implementing a secure boot process with a robust chain of trust.
highlights: Utilized cryptographic algorithms and hardware-backed security features (Secure Boot, TrustZone).

work.name: Marvell Technology Group
work.summary: Designed and implemented an SDK for Apple's HAP IoT on a WiFi+BLE product, Secure Tunnel.
highlights: Developed using networking layer libraries (HTTP, TCP/IP, GATT) on an RTOS with multithreaded support in C.

patents.title: Instant large objects/files truncation in a distributed file system.
Algorithm to perform optimal distributed file system directory Reverse Name Lookup.
Algorithm to perform intent-less update transactions in distributed file systems.
Methods for high throughput sequential/bulk key additions in a B+ tree.
High throughput distributed file system journaling using B+ Tree leaf packing.

paper.name: RoboChair : Health Monitoring IoT System for Wheelchair

projects.name: Distributed Resource Throttling Service
projects.summary: Designed and developed system for managing abstract resources (network bandwidth, task execution, etc) with cluster-wide rate limit capabilities.
highlights: Integral to 20+ controlpath and datapath services across the infrastructure.

projects.name: Instantaneous Large Object Truncation
projects.summary: Developed and patented an algorithm for efficient truncation of large objects, reducing operation time from linear to logarithmic by dereferencing data blocks from the B+Tree.
highlights: Truncation is ~10x faster for a 1-100GB file.

projects.name: Distributed Tracing Service
projects.summary: Designed an observability platform using OpenTelemetry and implemented a collector service to aggregate traces/logs/metrics.
highlights: Exporting data to AWS S3 and processing telemetry data with Apache Spark on AWS EMR.

projects.name: SBUnix - Design and Implementation of 64 bit kernel
projects.summary: Developed a preemptive multitasking kernel by designing scheduler, paging, memory allocator (kernel/user), kernel threads, ring-3 user process, etc.
highlights: Implemented system calls copy-on-write fork, execve, waitpid, kill, etc.
Developed Virtual File System and support for ELF parsing and loading.
Shell that supports executing scripts/binaries/pipes and background processes.
